Package com.mhealthatlas.enterprisemanagement.controller

Class EnterpriseManagementCommandController

java.lang.Object
com.mhealthatlas.enterprisemanagement.controller.EnterpriseManagementCommandController
@Controller
@RequestMapping("/enterprise-management")
public class EnterpriseManagementCommandController
extends java.lang.Object
EnterpriseManagementCommandController is the class containing all API endpoints for mutating enterprise informations.

    • EnterpriseManagementCommandController

  • Method Details

    • postEnterprise

      @PostMapping("/enterprises") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ROLE_Admin\')") @ResponseStatus(CREATED) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> postEnterprise​(@RequestBody EnterpriseDto group)
      Creates a new enterprise.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /enterprises

      Only mHealthAtlas administrators can access the api.

      Parameters:
      group - the enterprise data; not null; required request body parameter
      Returns:
      201 CREATED response, if the enterprise was created successfully;
      501 INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR otherwise;

    • updateEnterprise

      @PostMapping("/enterprises/{name}") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> updateEnterprise​(@PathVariable java.lang.String name, @RequestBody EnterpriseUpdateDto enterprise, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Updates an existing enterprise.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /enterprises/{name}

      Only mHealthAtlas, health insurance and company administrators are permitted to call this API endpoint. Health insurance and company administrators can only call this API endpoint for "their" enterprise.

      Parameters:
      name - the enterprise name; not null; request path parameter
      enterprise - the enterprise data; not null; required request body parameter
      authentication - the authentication object, injected by spring security
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the enterprise was updated successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY otherwise;

    • deleteEnterprise

      @DeleteMapping("/enterprises/{name}") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> deleteEnterprise​(@PathVariable java.lang.String name, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Deletes an existing enterprise.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP DELETE request calling /enterprises/{name}

      Only mHealthAtlas, health insurance and company administrators are permitted to call this API endpoint. Health insurance and company administrators can only call this API endpoint for "their" enterprise.

      Parameters:
      name - the enterprise name; not null; request path parameter
      authentication - the authentication object, injected by spring security
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the enterprise was deleted successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY, if the enterprise is not found;
      501 INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR otherwise;

    • postAdmin

      @PostMapping("/enterprises/{name}/admins") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ROLE_Admin\')") @ResponseStatus(CREATED) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> postAdmin​(@PathVariable java.lang.String name, @RequestBody UserDto user)
      Creates a new enterprise administrator.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /enterprises/{name}/admins

      Only mHealthAtlas administrators are permitted to call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      name - the enterprise name; not null; request path parameter
      user - the user data; not null; required request body parameter
      Returns:
      201 CREATED response, if the enterprise administrator was created successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY, if the enterprise is not found;
      501 INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR otherwise;

    • postUser

      @PostMapping("/enterprises/{name}/users") @ResponseStatus(CREATED) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> postUser​(@PathVariable java.lang.String name, @RequestBody UserDto user, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Creates a new enterprise user.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /enterprises/{name}/users

      Only mHealthAtlas, health insurance and company administrators are permitted to call this API endpoint. Health insurance and company administrators can only call this API endpoint for "their" enterprise.

      Parameters:
      name - the enterprise name; not null; request path parameter
      user - the user data; not null; required request body parameter
      authentication - the authentication object, injected by spring security
      Returns:
      201 CREATED response, if the enterprise user was created successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY, if the enterprise is not found;
      501 INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR otherwise;

    • updateUser

      @PostMapping("/enterprises/{name}/users/{userId}") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> updateUser​(@PathVariable java.lang.String name, @PathVariable java.util.UUID userId, @RequestBody UserUpdateDto user, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Updates an existing enterprise user.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /enterprises/{name}/users/{userId}

      Only mHealthAtlas, health insurance and company administrators and enterprise users are permitted to call this API endpoint. Health insurance and company administrators can only call this API endpoint for "their" enterprise. Enterprise users can only call this API endpoint for "themseelf".

      Parameters:
      name - the enterprise name; not null; request path parameter
      userId - the user id; not null; request path parameter
      user - the user data; not null; required request body parameter
      authentication - the authentication object, injected by spring security
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the enterprise user was updated successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY, if the enterprise or the user is not found;
      501 INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR otherwise;

    • updateUserDepartment

      @PostMapping("/enterprises/{name}/users/{userId}/department") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> updateUserDepartment​(@PathVariable java.lang.String name, @PathVariable java.util.UUID userId, @RequestBody DepartmentDto department, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Updates an existing enterprise users department.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /enterprises/{name}/users/{userId}/department

      Only mHealthAtlas, health insurance and company administrators are permitted to call this API endpoint. Health insurance and company administrators can only call this API endpoint for "their" enterprise.

      Parameters:
      name - the enterprise name; not null; request path parameter
      userId - the user id; not null; request path parameter
      department - the department data; not null; required request body parameter
      authentication - the authentication object, injected by spring security
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the enterprise user department was updated successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY, if the enterprise is not found;
      501 INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR otherwise;

    • deleteUser

      @DeleteMapping("/enterprises/{name}/users/{userId}") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> deleteUser​(@PathVariable java.lang.String name, @PathVariable java.util.UUID userId, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Deletes an existing enterprise user.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP DELETE request calling /enterprises/{name}/users/{userId}

      Only mHealthAtlas, health insurance and company administrators and enterprise users are permitted to call this API endpoint. Health insurance and company administrators can only call this API endpoint for "their" enterprise. Enterprise users can only call this API endpoint for "themseelf"

      Parameters:
      name - the enterprise name; not null; request path parameter
      userId - the user id; not null; request path parameter
      authentication - the authentication object, injected by spring security
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the enterprise user department was deleted successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY, if the enterprise is not found;
      501 INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR otherwise;

    • getUserGroup

      private java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> getUserGroup​(java.util.UUID userId)
      Utility method to get the user enterprise name of the user.
      Parameters:
      userId - the user id
      Returns:
      the user enterprise group, if the user exists and is assigned to any enterprise;
      an empty Optional otherwise;

    • getGroupId

      private java.util.Optional<java.util.UUID> getGroupId​(java.lang.String name)
      Utility method to get a enterprise id by name.
      Parameters:
      name - the enterprise name
      Returns:
      the enterprise id, if the enterprise exists;
      an empty Optional otherwise;
